body_html:
Nice @AEGQ
We are working on a similar patch which adds control over some configurations from the user.
Beside RDMA device we also want to have configurable port, gid index, and various QP and CQ parameters.
Still debating if to use env variables (like in your case) or passing some configuration file/proto to Server creation. What do you think ?

@byronyi, good to hear the script is working for you.
We are using the same script (tf_cnn_script) and we are still debugging the stuck issue.
It only happens with 6 or more GPUs per worker and when using real data (ImageNet).
The workers for some reason endlessly request the tensor "edge_4_global_step" (INT64 type) from the PS.
This is the part of the log from the worker that is repeated endlessly
https://gist.github.com/shamoya/745ece658346978e43899b334a0ee4ff

body:
Nice @AEGQ 
We are working on a similar patch which adds control over some configurations from the user. 
Beside RDMA device we also want to have configurable port, gid index, and various QP and CQ parameters. 
Still debating if to use env variables (like in your case) or passing some configuration file/proto to Server creation. What do you think ? 

@byronyi, good to hear the script is working for you.
We are using the same script (tf_cnn_script) and we are still debugging the stuck issue.
It only happens with 6 or more GPUs per worker and when using real data (ImageNet).
The workers for some reason endlessly request the tensor "edge_4_global_step" (INT64 type) from the PS.
This is the part of the log from the worker that is repeated endlessly
https://gist.github.com/shamoya/745ece658346978e43899b334a0ee4ff
